keyMoments.title: Whitebeard's Final Captain's Order
keyMoments.description: The crew receives Whitebeard's final order to escape Marineford and return to the New World without him. Whitebeard chooses to stay behind and sacrifice himself.
keyMoments.significance: Defining moment for the crew's future. Whitebeard's final order establishes that they must continue without him, setting up the eventual dissolution and transformation of the crew.

keyMoments.title: Witnessing Generational Change
keyMoments.description: The crew witnesses Whitebeard acknowledge that he is a remnant of the old era and that the new age does not have room for him.
keyMoments.significance: The crew must accept that their era is ending and that they represent the old generation that must make way for the new.

crewDynamics.leadership: Whitebeard leads as a father figure, with his crew viewing themselves as his sons. His final order demonstrates his willingness to sacrifice himself for their future.

keyMoments.title: Squard's Attempted Sacrifice
keyMoments.description: Squard and his crew attempt to ram their ship into Marineford to create a diversion for the Whitebeard alliance's escape, willing to sacrifice themselves.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the loyalty of Whitebeard's allied crews and their willingness to die for the alliance, despite Squard's earlier betrayal.

crewDynamics.leadership: Squard leads with determination but is seeking redemption for his manipulation by Akainu.
